I also do not recommend working on this position if you are going to school the stress is high and you are most likely to be burn out. Manager is nice and understanding with schedule but you will need to constantly remind your workdays. Regions is an amazing hospital overall. The nurses are helpful and the team work culture is ridiculous amazing.

job_title: Mental Health Associate in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
- Get to see what people with a mental disorder(s) act and behave like in-person.

- Obtained resources for recommendations.
cons:
- Despite having "mental health" in the job title, this job entails NO mental health work at all. Even though we are exposed to numerous disorders, we do not get to interact with them psychologically. Worked for a year now, and I haven't utilized anything from college, nor have I learned anything new in terms of psychopathology. This job focuses more on the nursing/physical care-giving role and none on mental health.

- Going off from the first point, the daily duties basically required as an MHA: take vital signs, serve food, take glucose readings, do housekeeping work (cleaning, making beds, doing laundry, taking out trash, etc), bathroom assistance, and checking in patient's belongings... no mental health duties whatsoever. A bachelor's degree should not be required in order to perform such basic and mundane tasks.

- Odd hours and required bi-weekends, which is not worth the small pay that is given.

- Depending on which floor you will be placed on, majority of the co-workers are nurses, which a handful can be conceited and demanding. There is a sense of social rankings with MHA's being the subordinate.

job_title: Administrative in Saint Paul, MN
pros: The people I work with generally seem like they really care and try to do the best job they can within the Regions culture.  I have had several friends that have had family members come here after serious accidents or illness and they felt like they got excellent care.
cons: Ineffective managers that are more interested in squeezing the last penny out of burnt out employees than actually managing (doesn't that involve people skills).  The lowest common denominator is the measuring stick - many employees would be fired if actually held accountable to meet their job description.  Those of us that do work hard are discouraged, non-listened-to, unrewarded, and when review time comes around - trivial things are used to point out that lack of perfection is going to keep salary increases to a minimum.

review_title: Great Place to Work, Great Place for Getting Care
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: I have worked at Regions for over 10 years, and think it is the best hospital in the cities for both patients and employees.  A safety net hospital that values charity care and education is rare, and finds the ability to pay for it. Pay and benefits are very fair, and my bosses have treated me well.  Patient satisfaction scores and quality scores are some of the best in the state.  The facility is being improved constantly for both patients and staff.  The hospital is committed to mental health through a beautiful new mental health patient care area of 100 beds - find one other hospital around that does that for the most challenging people in our community.  Management puts its money where its values are, and our staffing ratio is similar to other hospitals.
cons: You will work hard at Regions.  If it is a sleepy union job you want, this is not the place.  But if you want to be part of the best, who cares for the least of those among us, this is the place.

review_title: Great at first, but 10 years later worse off than when I started.
job_title: HIM Department in Saint Paul, MN
pros: The employees who are not management all seem very nice, personable and friendly. My co-workers are very dedicated and we work as a team.
cons: The senior management has put cutting the budget above patient care in almost every aspect. They have spent tons of money on private patient rooms and cut the nursing staff citing budget issues. Patient care is no longer the focus of this organization, at least as far as I can tell in the departments I am associated with.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: To be completely honest the ONLY thing I can drum up as a pro at this awful place is the PTO amount.......even though you could never get enough time away from this place to recharge.
cons: Anything and everything.  No breaks, awful management and pretty crappy pay for the peons of the hospital even though we did 25X more than the staff getting paid more than double what we were.  Regions is a very top heavy organization and because of this the little people do an obscene amount of work because they "can't afford" to hire anyone else.  Meanwhile management is nowhere to be found if there is a patient situation, especially around holidays or Friday afternoons.  Life has never been better since getting away from the toxic environment that is Regions.

review_title: I would NOT recommend to anyone
job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Saint Paul, MN
pros: There are no pros to working here. I have been miserable since my second week.
cons:
The in-patient pharmacy is extremely understaffed, which means they expect you to work mandatory overtime. You never come into a shift knowing if you will be mandated or not. 

Poor supervisory staff, can’t fill positions and don’t appreciate the staff the do have. I have walked past my supervisor in the hallway 4 times in the last two weeks with ZERO acknowledgment, let alone a smile and nod.  

Little to no training in my department. At a good thing I was knowledgeable about pharmacy before I started working here because they didn’t even have a training schedule for me for my first two weeks. And they didn’t have enough staff to train me even if they would have had a training schedule ready. I was pretty much just thrown in on my first day of work. 

After all expenses such as parking fees and union fees are taken out of my pay check, I net less per pay period than I was expecting, these fees were not mentioned to me either. I was told negotiating was not allowed.

job_title: in Saint Paul, MN
pros: People here are really engaged and want to make a difference for patients and families.  According to the most recent employee survey 90% of staff are satisfied with Regions as their employer--I'm one of those 90%!  There is a true commitment to do what is best for the patient and an equal focus on supporting employees.  I'm really impressed with wellness support such as the resiliency center and our new employee fitness center that will open this year (our current fitness center is a bit small!)
cons: The healthcare industry is a challenge.  Finding the right balance to have the "extras" while maintaining financial viability is a challenge.  Our leadership team has done a great job managing our financial health and long-term viability...but sometimes it's hard to "do without".

job_title: Human Resources in Saint Paul, MN
pros: I have had a really great experience with Regions Hospital. Since I have started employment, I have been welcomed by everyone on my team and everyone has been so helpful and friendly. My manager has also been great; I have obtained more responsibility and feel like I am really an asset to my team. Aside from my work experience, the benefits are great - especially the PTO schedule. My co-workers also encourage me to utilize it, and we are very helpful towards each other when we need a day or two off.
cons: Paying for parking every month is probably the biggest con that I can think of right now. It is kind of a bummer, but at the same time, it is nice to know that my vechicle is in a safe and secure parking ramp.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
Benefits were great, including paid time off
Positive work environment, for the most part
cons: Over my time at Regions, I slowly realized there was no growth in my position. In a business role, my manager/supervisor didn't seem to want to develop me despite requests for more responsibility or work and there was really no upward movement for me. In my last months with the company, the managers all took promotions and salary increases, but I was stuck in my 2.5% a year salary increase that wouldn't change until a position opened up. Not a good place for a young professional to stay, as many of the staff has been there for 15+ years.

job_title: Mental Health Associate in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Great team environment; Professional staff; Excellent Managers on the Mental Health Units; Excellent Charge RN's (all shifts); New and clean work environment (Mental Health Department)
cons: Part-Time work can make it hard to support a family of five, when there are slow times and/or lower patient populations; Need for a secondary job to stay on time or get ahead on household bills; Higher rates of  health insurance (in 2017) due to an increase co-pays, lower HRA insurance payment totals, and increased out-of-pocket expenses related to 'The Affordable Healthcare Act.'

review_title: Great hospital to work for, staff satisfaction is pretty good but seems to have declined in recent years.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Not a union hospital but stays competitive with pay and benefits as far as i know. Most of the leadership staff are excellent, who listen to staff suggestions and input. Level 1 trauma hospital with a great reputation for trauma care.
cons: Challenges of inner city hospital emergency department. A few supervisors are overbearing and abrasive.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Team Oriented environment.  Diverse patient population.  Scheduler is within the birth center and attempt to approve most request.  Flexibility with FTE positions.  Resources are available for education.
cons: Low census leads to off premise on call at least once a pay period.  Lower than average pay for RN.  Required to work three holidays and no added pay for picking up other holidays.  Extra pay only available for Christmas Eve, Christmas, New Years, New Years Eve.

job_title: Registered Nurse, Orthopedics in Saint Paul, MN
pros: The bennefits are highly compeditive.  They have and aggressive PTO acrumint schedule.  The managment is very flexible.  The hospiatal has had a high census for the past year= lots of work to be had.  I got hired as a 0.5 and have yet to work less than 0.7
cons: The hospiatal has had a high census for the past year= lots of work to be done.  There was a rush to get me on the floor and as a new grad, I didnt have a ton of confidence in working alone.

review_title:
Fantastic Experience
Well managed facility, former CEO Brock Nelson active participant in developing new programs
job_title: Physical Medine and Rehabilitation Department in Saint Paul, MN
pros: The people that work and care for patients and families take their role seriously, and are genuine caregivers.  A team oriented approach,clean and updated environment provides a centrally located facility in the twin cities of Minnesota.
cons: As with any hospital employee parking can be a downfall, and paying a monthly fee to be in a convenient ramp was a drawback. However the competitive salary made up for this.

review_title: I Steven Johnson have been a Surgical Reprocessing Tech for about 18 years looking to committ to something different
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Very good Professional people Very good Advancements within the company also great company incentives

review_title: Stay away if you have any self-respect . . . because they'll do everything they can to take it away.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Nice co-workers, extremely competent and if they were the only factor in job satisfaction, this would be a 5 star place to work.
cons: Management philosophy - if you keep people involved in committees and faux efforts to improve the workplace, they'll be happy being paid less and less each year as compared to increases in the cost of living.  Ignoring true innovators so that they either get tired of hammering their head against a brick wall or find a more forward thinking company.

review_title: Not for those who are looking for career advancement
job_title: Staffing Coordinator in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Healthpartners does offer great benefits
cons: Management is reactive and does not support its employees, while focusing on making sure their friends are promoted. Closed minded.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Great experience, great teamwork, and high level of skill. I would go here for treatment without a doubt. It is a very good hospital.
cons: I think that leadership is lacking in some areas. Especially as it pertains to listening to the RN's and making changes that benefit them. I think the focus could be more on employee satisfaction.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
The company provides a certain amount of money for nurses to get continuing education credits. There is also a different stash of money that reimburses for certifications that nurses study for and get. There is yearly bonus check nurses get for a maximum of 2 certifications. 
Great health benefits package especially in-network.
Shared-governance model is excellent.
cons:
Parking ramp is a distance away. 
Non-union which I think is important to some nurses and not important to other nurses.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Paul, MN
pros: I love working here at Regions. My coworkers and managers are so supportive and caring. Great benefits, especially with PTO, even with part time work.
cons: People work here for a long time so there is not that much room for career advancement. Things don't open up too often.

job_title: Phlebotomist in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Great benefits; reasonable work load (management ensures employees take breaks, will help if it's busy); will hire additional staff when needed
cons: Very cliquey; previous boss hired his friends who then antagonized people not in their group; more/better defined training needed for some positions; cost of living raises needed

job_title: Cath Lab Tech in Saint Paul, MN
pros: At Regions hospital the care is exceptional. They try to make every patient as happy and satisfied as possible as well as the best care around.
cons: Work hard and get more responsibilities but no more recognition or pay. No raise for cost of living even, and change the way you are paid for calls to benefit them most. Will tell you to report any problems or ideas, but will can ridiculed rather than praised for anything that doesn't either make them more money or take less time.

job_title: Director in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Data manager has an English degree and doesn’t understand data analytics so there is no accountability
cons: Total lack of professionalism  jobs are not posted and interviews are not conducted unqualified people in leadership positions. Data quality group has a high turnover rate most don’t last 3 years. Underpaid and unqualified are all that remain. They will not train you and your skills will dry up. Management will ask you to fidge the numbers to make things better or to ensure they get their bonus.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Co-workers are nice and caring about the patients they serve.
cons: Poor pay, vacation time off maxes at 5 yrs, no incentives for long tenured employees, heavy workload, 33% employee turn over in last 12 months.

job_title: Education Specialist in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Large stable, the processes are well defined.  Opportunity for growth within the organization.  The compensation is good with time because of the size of the company
cons: Rigidly because of the size of the company.  An isolated issue can arise and the whole organization must respond.  When it's good it's good, but can get off track.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Salary is higher than most other hospitals in the metro.  Plenty of hours are available, offer lots of OT.

I don't feel supported by senior leadership
I wish they took safety and security concerns more seriously.  I often don't feel safe at work 
While they can't control this, the patient population is difficult, demanding, and violent

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN

Friendly atmosphere

pros: I just a volunteer at Regions Hospital since end of 2013 until now. I really like it. For me, I can feel that our hospital care about employees, and volunteers like I expected. Staffs are really nice, friendly, knowledge, I've learnt new things every time I am volunteering here.
cons: More fountain water. :)

job_title: Staff RN in Saint Paul, MN
